techmeme.title: Raspberry Pi jumps by up to 39% on its London trading debut, hitting a £542M market cap, after pricing shares at £2.80, and expects to ship 8.4M PCs in 2024 (Stephanie Stacey/Financial Times)
Tech execs and experts say Arm and Qualcomm's contract dispute could halt the shipment of new Arm-based PCs; the trial is scheduled to begin in December 2024 (Max A. Cherney/Reuters)
Zero-knowledge cryptography firm Nexus Labs raised a $25M Series A co-led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and Pantera Capital (Timmy Shen/The Block)
Atos picks a group led by Onepoint, its top shareholder, to take over the IT company; the group will invest €250M and convert €2.9B of Atos' debt into shares (Benoit Berthelot/Bloomberg)
A California administrative judge rejects Tesla's appeal to dismiss claims by CA's DMV alleging the company overstated its vehicles' self-driving capabilities (Rachel Graf/Bloomberg)
